intro: Brachyglottis lagopus, commonly known as the silver fern, is a low-growing perennial plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. Brachyglottis lagopus is well adapted to coastal and rocky environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
